intro: Scaevola phlebopetala, commonly known as the rainbow flower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that come in a range of colors, including pink, purple, and white. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and thrives in well-drained soils. It has small, narrow leaves and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant appearance. Scaevola phlebopetala is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
